bestBHT.bht: Jesus assures His disciples that they already know the way to the place He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all that the Father reveals, and THE LIFE that flows from the Godhead. By following His precepts and imitating His example, they are already familiar with the path. He has spoken to them about His departure and the Father's house, and they understand that His journey involves suffering and death. In knowing Jesus, they already know the way.

Henry Alford: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know."
ye know the way to the place to which I am going.
sometimes we praise a man to put him in mind of his duty.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Christ is 'THE WAY' to the Father—'no man cometh unto the Father but by Me.'"
He is 'THE TRUTH' of all we find in the Father when we get to Him."
He is all 'THE LIFE' that shall ever flow to us and bless us from the Godhead thus approached and thus manifested in Him.
Albert Barnes: Whither I go ye know - He had so often told them that he was to die, and rise, and ascend to heaven, that they could not but understand it."
The way ye know - That is, the way that leads to the dwelling-place to which he was going.
The way which they were to tread was to obey his precepts, imitate his example, and follow him.
Marvin Vincent: I go [υπαγω] . Withdraw from you. See on 8 21.
Ye know, and the way ye know [οιδατε, και την οδον οιδατε] . The best texts omit the second ye know, and the and before the way; reading, whither I go ye know the way.
John Calvin: They know that his death is not a destruction, but a passage to the Father.
We must see Christ, by the eyes of faith, in the heavenly glory and a blessed immortality.
We ought to know that he is the first-fruits of our life, and that the way which was closed against us has been opened by him.
Philip Schaff: To ‘know’ is not merely to know of; it is to have inward experience of."
As, therefore,’ whither I go ‘is the Father’s presence; as Jesus is the way to the Father; and as they have experimental knowledge of Him, they ‘know the way.’"
Ye know me; and, in knowing me, ye know the way; it is already yours.
Archibald T. Robertson: Ye know the way (οιδατε την οδον). Definite allusion to the puzzle of Peter in John 13:36. The path to the Father's house is now plain.
John Gill: They might have known, at least, whither he was going, since he had spoke of his Father's house, and of his going to prepare a place for them there."
The way to his Father's house lay through sufferings and death, in which way they also were to follow him to his kingdom and glory.
This also they might have known from some expressions of his, that the way to his Father's house lay through sufferings and death.
John Wesley: The way — Of faith, holiness, sufferings.

bhtAttempts.bht: Jesus reassures his disciples that they already know the way to where He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all that the Father reveals, and THE LIFE that flows from the Godhead. The disciples have heard Jesus speak of His death and resurrection, and they understand that His departure is not a destruction, but a passage to the Father. They are to follow Him on the path of obedience, imitation, and faith, knowing that He has opened the way to his Father's house through his sufferings and death. In knowing Jesus, they already know the way.

Jesus assures His disciples that they know the way to the place He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all that the Father reveals, and THE LIFE that flows from the Godhead. They understand that His departure is not destruction, but a journey to His Father's house. By following His precepts and imitating His example, they are already acquainted with the path. The disciples know Jesus, and in knowing Him, they know the way.

Jesus assures His disciples that they already know the way to the place He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all that the Father reveals, and THE LIFE that flows from the Godhead. By following His precepts and imitating His example, they are already familiar with the path. He has spoken to them about His departure and the Father's house, and they understand that His journey involves suffering and death. In knowing Jesus, they already know the way.

Jesus reassures His disciples that they already know the way to where He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all that the Father reveals, and THE LIFE that flows from the Godhead. The disciples understand that His departure is not destruction, but a journey to the Father's house. By following His precepts, imitating His example, and having faith, they are already acquainted with the path. In knowing Jesus, they already know the way.

Jesus assures His disciples that they already know the way to the place He is going. He is THE WAY to the Father, THE TRUTH of all we find in the Father, and THE LIFE that flows to us from the Godhead. The disciples understand that His departure is not a destruction but a passage to the Father's house. They are to follow Him on the path of faith, obedience, and imitation. In knowing Him, they already know the way.
